body_html:
As an interesting follow-up, the following script:

import torch

def foo(x, y):
  return 2*x + y

traced_foo = torch.jit.trace(foo, (torch.rand(3).cuda(), torch.rand(3).cuda()))

traced_foo(torch.rand(3), torch.rand(3))

Will result in 3 calls. Whether the extra call when receiving CPU inputs is intended is unclear. The third call will not happen if the inputs are on the GPU.

traced_foo = torch.jit.trace(foo, (torch.rand(3).cuda(), torch.rand(3).cuda()))

traced_foo(torch.rand(3), torch.rand(3))

Will result in 3 calls. Whether the extra call when receiving CPU inputs is intended is unclear. The third call will not happen if the inputs are on the GPU.
body:
As an interesting follow-up, the following script:

```
import torch

def foo(x, y):
  return 2*x + y

traced_foo = torch.jit.trace(foo, (torch.rand(3).cuda(), torch.rand(3).cuda()))

traced_foo(torch.rand(3), torch.rand(3))
```

Will result in 3 calls. Whether the extra call when receiving CPU inputs is intended is unclear. The third call will not happen if the inputs are on the GPU.
